alert.note: Alert for Northern Bristol; Southern Bristol; Western Norfolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 2:14PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Windham, southwestern Norfolk, northwestern Bristol, northeastern Kent, Providence and northern Bristol Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 214 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Glocester, or 10 miles west of Johnston, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor nuisance flooding of typically flood prone areas. Locations impacted include... Providence, Warwick, Cranston, Pawtucket, East Providence, Cumberland, North Providence, Johnston, North Attleborough, Attleboro, Smithfield, Lincoln, Central Falls, Killingly, Barrington, Burrillville, Swansea, Seekonk, North Smithfield and Rehoboth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams.

area.areaDesc: Northern Bristol; Southern Bristol; Western Norfolk
